p: The development of cost-efficient diagnostic point of care (POC) systems for the opportune diagnosis of infectious diseases is a research niche of high relevance [ 1, 2]. The recent pandemic/epidemic episodes associated with viral diseases (e.g., influenza epi-centered in México in 2009 [ 3, 4], Ebola in West Africa in 2013–2015 [ 5– 7], and Zika in Latin America and Southeast Asia in 2016 [ 8– 10]) are tangible and cruel reminders of the need for portable, low-cost, and easy-to-use diagnostic systems that can effectively address epidemic episodes in remote or underprivileged areas [ 5, 9, 11, 12].
